contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "You do not need to stay near this mountain any longer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: You have lived long enough in this hill country

contextId.information: The word "turn" is an idiom for beginning action. AT: "Start again on your journey" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Turn and take your journey

contextId.information: The words "lift up your eyes" are an idiom that means look. AT: "look"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: lift up your eyes

contextId.information: This is an idiom. "The heart of" means "the middle of" or "the innermost part of," and "heaven" here refers to the sky. AT: "with a fire that went up to the sky" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: with fire to the heart of heaven

contextId.information: This is an idiom. Moses speaks of the stars as if they were small objects like food that Yahweh was dividing and giving out to the people groups. AT: "that Yahweh your God has put there to help all people groups" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: of which Yahweh your God has given a share all the peoples

contextId.information: This is an idiom that can be translated "people who belong only to him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: a people of his own inheritance

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "and you make Yahweh your God angry by doing what he says is evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: and do what is evil in the sight of Yahweh your God, to provoke him to anger

contextId.information: The idiom "with all ... heart" means "completely" and "with all ... soul" means "with all ... being." These two phrases have similar meanings. AT: "with all your being" or "with all your energy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: with all your heart and with all your soul

contextId.information: Use your language's idiom for two people who are close to each other and looking at each other when they are speaking to each other. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: face to face

contextId.information: If your language has an idiom that expresses a strong desire for something, you might want to use it here. AT: "I would be very happy if there were" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Oh, that there were

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "a land where plenty of milk and honey flow" or "a land that is excellent for cattle and farming" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: a land flowing with milk and honey

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "you must always remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: will be in your heart

contextId.information: This idiom is a command and a blessing. If the Israelites obey Yahweh, they will receive blessings from Yahweh. AT: "Do what Yahweh says is right and good" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: You will do what is right and good in the sight of Yahweh

contextId.information: This idiom means "repays them quickly and openly so that they know God has punished them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: repays those who hate him to their face

contextId.information: This is an idiom for "your children." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: the fruit of your body

contextId.information: The people should not be afraid even if they notice that the nations are stronger than they are. AT: "Even if you say in your heart"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: If you say in your heart ... do not be afraid

contextId.information: The Israelites will completely destroy all the people from those nations, and in the future no one will remember them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: you will make their name perish from under heaven

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "You must remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: You will call to mind

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "Remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Call to mind

contextId.information: "with the authority of Yahweh" or "as a representative of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: in his name

contextId.information: The idiom "with all your heart" means "completely" and "with all your soul" means "with all your being." These two phrases have a similar meaning. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:29|4:29]]. AT: "with all your being" or "with all your energy." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: with all your heart and with all your soul

contextId.information: The idiom "with all your heart" means "completely" and "with ... soul" means "with all your being." These two phrases have similar meanings. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:29|4:29]]. AT: "with all your being" or "with all your energy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: with all your heart and with all your soul

contextId.information: The idiom "with all your heart" means "completely" and "with ... soul" means "with all your being." These two phrases have similar meaning. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:29|4:29]]. AT: "with all your being" or "with all your energy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: with all your heart and with all your soul

contextId.information: A bosom is a person's chest. This is a idiom that he holds close to his chest, which means he loves and cherishes her. AT: "wife you love" or "wife you dearly embrace" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: wife of your bosom

contextId.information: Here "soul" represents the person's life. This means the person cares for his friend as much as he cares for his own life. AT: "your dearest friend" or "a friend you love as much as you love yourself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: friend who is to you like your own soul

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "you must not demand it back" or "you must not require repayment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: your hand must release

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: call to mind

contextId.information: The phrase "put the sickle to the standing grain" is a way of referring to the beginning of harvest time. AT: "from the time that you begin harvesting the grain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: from the time you begin to put the sickle to the standing grain

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: call to mind

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "strongly desires" or "really wants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: desires with all his soul

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "give him over" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: turn him over

contextId.information: Here "rise up" means to stand up in court and speak against someone to a judge. AT: "must not speak to the judges about something bad that a man did" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: must not rise up against a man

contextId.information: Here "rise up" means to stand up in court and speak against someone to a judge.  AT: "tells the judge that a man sinned in order to get the man in trouble" or "tells the judge that a man sinned, so the judge will punish him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: rises up against any man to testify against him of wrongdoing

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "until the people of the city lose the war" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: until it falls

contextId.information: This is an idiom for water that is moving. AT: "a stream" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: running water

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "and do not treat your people Israel as if they are guilty of killing an innocent person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: and do not put guilt for innocent bloodshed in the midst of your people Israel

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "that son is the one who shows that the man can become the father of sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: that son is the beginning of his strength

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "act as if you do not see them" or "go away without doing anything" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: hide yourself from them

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "you must not act as if you do not see that he has lost something" or "you must not go away without doing anything" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: you must not hide yourself

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "for his entire life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: during all his days

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "may be a full member of the Israelite community" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: may enter the assembly of Yahweh

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "may not be a full member of the Israelite community" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: may not belong to the assembly of Yahweh

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "as long as you are a nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: during all your days

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "all that you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: all that you put your hand to

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "Remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Call to mind

contextId.information: This is an idiom. The Israelites considered the new day as starting when the sun went down. AT: "you should pay the man on the same day he does the work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: the sun must not go down on this unsettled matter

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "you may live for a long time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: your days may be long

contextId.information: The idiom "with all ... heart" means "completely" and "with all ... soul" means "with all your being." These two phrases have similar meaning. AT: "with all your being" or "with all your energy." Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:29|4:29]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: with all your heart and with all your soul

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "he will make you more important than" or "he will make you greater than" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: he will set you high above

contextId.information: These idioms for "your children, and your crops, and all your animals" form a merism for everything the Israelites valued. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: the fruit of your body, and the fruit of your ground, and the fruit of your beasts

contextId.information: This is an idiom. The actual number could be more or less than seven. AT: "in many different directions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: seven ways

contextId.information: This idiom means foreigners will have more power, money, and honor than the Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: rise up above you higher and higher; you yourself will come down lower and lower

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "from places that you know nothing about" ([[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: from the ends of the earth

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "You will not know whether you will live or die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Your life will hang in doubt before you

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "congratulate himself" or "encourage himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: bless himself in his heart

contextId.information: Here "these things" refer to the blessings and curses described in chapters 28-29. The phrase "have come on you" is an idiom that means to happen. AT: "When all these things happen to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: When all these things have come on you

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "remember them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: call them to mind

contextId.information: The idiom "with all ... heart" means "completely" and "with all ... soul" means "with all your being." These two phrases have similar meaning. AT: "with all your being" or "with all your energy." Translate these words as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:29|4:29]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: with all your heart and with all your soul

contextId.information: The idiom "with all ... heart" means "completely" and "with all ... soul" means "with all your being." These two phrases have similar meaning. AT: "with all your being" or "with all your energy." Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:29|4:29]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: with all your heart and with all your soul

contextId.information: These three phrases are idioms for "in children ... in calves ... in crops." Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:03|28:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: in the fruit of your body ... in the fruit of your cattle ... in the fruit of your ground

contextId.information: The idiom "with all ... heart" means "completely" and "with all ... soul" means "with all your being." These two phrases have similar meaning. AT: "with all your being" or "with all your energy." Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:29|4:29]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: with all your heart and all your soul

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "Make them memorize and sing it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Put it in their mouths

contextId.information: This is an idiom. "put the nations in the places where they would live." Similar words, "giving to you as an inheritance," appear in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:21|4:21]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: gave the nations their inheritance

contextId.information: This is an idiom. The apple of an eye refers to the dark part inside the eyeball that allows a person to see. This is a very important and sensitive part of the body. This means that the people of Israel are very important to God and something he protects. AT: "he protected him as something very valuable and precious" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: he guarded him as the apple of his eye

contextId.information: This is an idiom. The word "him" refers to the people of Israel. AT: "Yahweh made them ride on high places of the land" or "Yahweh helped them take and occupy the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: He made him ride on high places of the land

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "I will turn away from them" or "I will stop helping them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: I will hide my face from them

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "Pay attention to" or "Think about" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Fix your mind on
